comment: I took Pro Practice III with Prof Carpenter, I knew he'd be good for a lecture class. I really liked the subject matter and info we learned about the build/design process both ethically and financially. A lot of reading first half of the semester but then it was mainly smaller homework, only one final exam.

This was my second time taking Dr. Carpenters studio, and second time that Ive really enjoyed having him as a professor for it. He runs his studios like real life work situations so were always collaborating or taking to someone else which is definitely really cool and something I think we all enjoyed. Hes very passionate about what he does and

Prof. Carpenter is an outstanding professor! He has a great deal of practical work experience as an architect, which is a great resource for students in the integrated studio. Come to class prepared with your design ideas printed out, and ask questions. Be ready to put in the necessary work for this class. Will def be taking Prof. Carpenter again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Pr. Carpenter studio is my favorite studio I ever took. Very knowledgeable and respect for your time, Pr Carpenter help me to get 3rd place in a competition. If you do your work you get the grade you want!
Definitely a hard professor, but understanding. Always available for communication and feedback, but you have to produce work to get it. Pushes to make projects the best that they can be.

I took Dr. Carpenter spring semester of 3rd year and it was one of my favorite studios. Hes a cool professor and even cooler guy. He gives great feedback once you produce the work and will give you several chances for revisions and edits. Produce the work and be ON time to review and youll have no issues in his studio.

I took prof. Carpenter for 4th year comprehensive studio and loved the way he teaches. He gives really good feedback and makes sure you learn to earn your grade, with his experience from being a practicing architect as well as a professor. Then I was lucky enough to take him again as my Thesis advisor for final project. Great professor.

Dr. Carpenter is one of the best professors that I ever take and I will recommended to any one that is looking in learning architecture, he listening, caring and he will make you work for your ideas, and giving the opportunity to prove yourself, and I am so thankful to him.

Of all the cultures profs at KSU, I learned the least from him. It was nice only having class half of the time but overall, I can't really recall anything I learned specifically from his class other than the specific topics I had to research for the midterm and presentation. He's very unengaged but grades hard and puts a lot of work on you.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: I took this class spring of my 3rd year, I have to say it was one of my favorite studios. I did end up getting an A in the end but I had to work for it. I loved the fact that we were in groups because it really thought me how to work with others within the realm of architecture. Overall he is a pretty cool guy and is always willing to help.

Professor Carpenter was amazing. I enjoy a good challenge and he provided that. Definitely learned a lot from this man and owe a lot of my success to him and the drive he instilled on me. Seeing these students rate him as they have disgusts me. Life isn't a hand out people, you have to earn it. I can't recommend this man enough...

He is an amazing teacher. He will go out of his way to help his students as long as you put the effort into the class! He is very knowledgeable in the field of architecture and cultures! Would definitely recommend him as a professor and friend!

As the other reviews say, he's selfish. Pops in to class, doesn't stick around to give feedback, grades based on his opinion of you, just an overall lazy professor. He has students run his PERSONAL errands. It's wild. Even had them use our studio time to get emails & #s of people he was going to call so he could ask them to vote for him in AIA.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: At first he will make you think that he likes you, he only cares for himself. He gets students to do work for him because hes busy. Just finished having him. I feel I didnt learn anything and was a waisted class. if u take him, be prepared to have him take over your projects. Hes an old fashion teacher.. nothing but hand drawings.

Carpenter cares about one person and one person only. Himself. Few people are as unjustifiably narcissistic. His ideas and feedback are mediocre at best. Studio hours apply to all his students, not him. He shows up when he wants. Taking credit for ideas, designs and accomplishments that he barely influenced is his M.O. Steer clear.
Dr. Carpenter is such an amazing professor, he made me work hard and I was so afraid of not passing the class ! Now I got my A and I am so thankful to him. Best professor ever !
Good knowledge about the class and field. Ready to share is historical knowledge in class. Though the class was more self taught through writing papers and project it was helpful.
Great Professor, Extremely helpful as long as you provide the required work and show interest in the subject. Very knowledgeable and introduces the students to different medias for presentating work.

Dr. Carpenter has a wealth of knowledge, he is exceptionally helpful, but that hugely depends on the work you provide to him, the more work you are able to present for him to critique, the more you are going to get out of him.

Great professor who has experience not just in academia, but also practical knowledge that he's gained through years of having a practice. If you take Dr. Carpenter do not mistake his recommendation to simplify your project as disinterest, he wants to see a complete body of work rather than a large amount of information that has no narrative.

He is not very helpful.  He doesn't seem to have many design ideas, and the ideas he does have aren't worth pursuing.  He is only concerned at making himself look good.  If it doesn't benefit him personally or professionally, he will not put much effort into it.  He does not grade based on merit, but on personal biases, which is easy with a studio.
